com.ojcoleman.ahni.transcriber

Class TranscriberAdaptor<T extends Activator>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.ahni.transcriber.TranscriberAdaptor<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Transcriber<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HyperNEATTranscriber, NEATTranscriberBain

    public abstract class TranscriberAdaptor<T extends Activator>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Transcriber<T>

      T transcribe(Chromosome c, T substrate, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> options)
      Sub-classes can override this method to convert the genotype to a phenotype, using an existing substrate object to allow performance gains by avoiding destroying and creating large objects or arrays, and optionally providing additional options.

    • Field Detail

      • HYPERNEAT_CONNECTION_WEIGHT_MIN

        public static final java.lang.String HYPERNEAT_CONNECTION_WEIGHT_MIN
        The minimum weight values in the substrate network. If this is not specified then the negated value of HYPERNEAT_CONNECTION_WEIGHT_MAX will be used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBSTRATE_NEURON_MODEL_PARAMS

        Property to specify CPPN outputs that set the parameters for each neuron. Allowable values are implementation dependent.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBSTRATE_NEURON_MODEL_PARAMS_MIN

        public static final java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_NEURON_MODEL_PARAMS_MIN

        See Also:

      • SUBSTRATE_NEURON_MODEL_PARAMS_MAX

        Property to specify maximum values for the parameters for each neuron. Allowable values are implementation dependent.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBSTRATE_NEURON_MODEL_PARAMS_THRESHOLD

        public static final java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_NEURON_MODEL_PARAMS_THRESHOLD
        Property to specify the minimum CPPN output required to produce a non-zero parameter value. Actual parameter values will scale from [0, ann.transcriber.neuron.model.params.max] or [ann.transcriber.neuron.model.params.min, 0].
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBSTRATE_NEURON_MODEL_TYPES

        public static final java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_NEURON_MODEL_TYPES
        Property to specify allowable neuron model types. Typically: the CPPN only needs to specify the type to use if there is more than one type; if there are only two neuron types then a single CPPN output will be used to specify which to use, otherwise a "whichever CPPN output has the highest output value" encoding will be used to specify the type. Allowable values are implementation dependent, however by default it is assumed that a parameter name followed by one or more integer values to specify the allowable types is used (this assumes that the model is set-up with a parameter that can take on integer values to decide what type the model is).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBSTRATE_SYNAPSE_MODEL

        public static final java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_SYNAPSE_MODEL
        Property to specify which synapse model to use. Allowable values are implementation dependent.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBSTRATE_SYNAPSE_MODEL_PARAMS

        public static final java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_SYNAPSE_MODEL_PARAMS
        Property to specify CPPN outputs that set the parameters for each synapse. Allowable values are implementation dependent.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBSTRATE_SYNAPSE_MODEL_PARAMS_MIN

        public static final java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_SYNAPSE_MODEL_PARAMS_MIN

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBSTRATE_SYNAPSE_MODEL_PARAMS_MAX

        public static final java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_SYNAPSE_MODEL_PARAMS_MAX
        Property to specify maximum values for the parameters for each synapse. Allowable values are implementation dependent.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBSTRATE_SYNAPSE_MODEL_PARAMS_THRESHOLD

        public static final java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_SYNAPSE_MODEL_PARAMS_THRESHOLD
        Property to specify the minimum CPPN output required to produce a non-zero parameter value. Actual parameter values will scale from [0, ann.transcriber.neuron.model.params.max] or [ann.transcriber.neuron.model.params.min, 0].
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBSTRATE_SYNAPSE_MODEL_DISABLE_PARAM

        public static final java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_SYNAPSE_MODEL_DISABLE_PARAM
        Property to specify which parameter in the synapse model will be set to 0 if the connection should not be enabled or plastic. This is typically applied to a "learning rate" parameter. Usage and allowable values are implementation dependent. The criteria for whether a synapse should be enabled is implementation dependent.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBSTRATE_SYNAPSE_MODEL_TYPES

        public static final java.lang.String SUBSTRATE_SYNAPSE_MODEL_TYPES
        Property to specify allowable synapse model types. Typically: the CPPN only needs to specify the type to use if there is more than one type; if there are only two synapse types then a single CPPN output will be used to specify which to use, otherwise a "whichever CPPN output has the highest output value" encoding will be used to specify the type. Allowable values are implementation dependent, however by default it is assumed that a parameter name followed by one or more integer values to specify the allowable types is used (this assumes that the model is set-up with a parameter that can take on integer values to decide what type the model is).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • neuronModelParamsThreshold

        protected double[] neuronModelParamsThreshold
        the minimum (possibly CPPN) output required to produce a non-zero parameter value. Actual parameter values are typically scaled from [0, ann.transcriber.neuron.model.params.max] or [ann.transcriber.neuron.model.params.min, 0]. Not always implemented.

      • synapseModelParamsMin

        The maximum values for each synapse model parameter.

      • synapseModelParamsRange

        protected double[] synapseModelParamsRange
        The value range for each synapse model parameter (synapseModelParamsMax[i] - synapseModelParamsMin[i]).

      • synapseModelParamsThreshold

        protected double[] synapseModelParamsThreshold
        the minimum (possibly CPPN) output required to produce a non-zero parameter value. Actual parameter values are typically scaled from [0, ann.transcriber.neuron.model.params.max] or [ann.transcriber.neuron.model.params.min, 0]. Not always implemented.

        public void init(Properties props)

      • transcribe

        public T transcribe(Chromosome c,
           T substrate,
           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> options)
                               throws TranscriberException
        Sub-classes can override this method to convert the genotype to a phenotype, using an existing substrate object to allow performance gains by avoiding destroying and creating large objects or arrays, and optionally providing additional options.
        Parameters:
        c - chromosome to transcribe
        substrate - An existing phenotype substrate to reuse
        options - A set of transcriber specific options. May be null.
        Returns:
        phenotype
        Throws:
        TranscriberException

      • getNeuronTypeCount

        public int getNeuronTypeCount()
        Get the number of available neuron types.

      • getSynapseTypeCount

        public int getSynapseTypeCount()
        Get the number of available synapse types.

      • getNeuronParameterCount

        public int getNeuronParameterCount()
        Get the number of available neuron model parameters.

      • getSynapseParameterCount

        public int getSynapseParameterCount()
        Get the number of available synapse model parameters.

      • getChromosomeInputNeuronCount

        public int getChromosomeInputNeuronCount()
        May be overridden to specify how many input neurons the Chromosome should encode. This default implementation returns the value specified by the property NeatConfiguration.STIMULUS_SIZE_KEY if given, otherwise NeatConfiguration.DEFAULT_STIMULUS_SIZE.

      • getChromosomeOutputNeuronCount

        public int getChromosomeOutputNeuronCount()
        May be overridden to specify how many output neurons the Chromosome should encode. This default implementation returns the value specified by the property NeatConfiguration.RESPONSE_SIZE_KEY if given, otherwise NeatConfiguration.DEFAULT_RESPONSE_SIZE.
